content.question: Which of the following best explains why top predators can have up to 60 times as much of persistent organic pollutant (<math alttext="P O P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) as their prey and up to 600 times as much of the pollutant as producers?

choices.label: <math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> accumulate in the body fat of living organisms. <math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increase in concentration as they move up the food chain.

<math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> can travel over long distances by wind or water. Predators have greater access to different locations than do producers and therefore have higher concentrations of <math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are not carbon-based compounds, so animal digestive systems lack enzymes capable of breaking them down. <math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> biomagnify in the fatty tissues of animals but not in plants.

<math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are solids, which only animals can ingest. Therefore, <math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have a greater effect on secondary and tertiary levels of food chains.

content.answer: <math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> accumulate in the body fat of living organisms. <math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increase in concentration as they move up the food chain.
